com.opengamma.strata.collect.id

Interface Link<T extends IdentifiableBean>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of the target
    All Superinterfaces:
    StandardIdentifiable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    SecurityLink, StandardLink

    public interface Link<T extends IdentifiableBean>
extends StandardIdentifiable
    Defines a link to a target object using an identifier.

    A link provides loose coupling between different parts of the object model. For example, an equity trade can hold a link to the underlying equity. The two objects can be updated independently of each other. If the link resolver supports historic versions, then the correct version of the target will be returned when resolved. The target object should be immutable to ensure the safety of the link.

    A link can be in one of two states, resolvable and resolved.

    In the resolvable state, the link contains the identifier and type of the target object. The target can only be obtained using a LinkResolver.

    In the resolved state, the link directly embeds the target object.

    Links are expected to be resolvable. It is reasonable to expect that when resolve(LinkResolver) is called, the target of the link is available. For this reason, if the target is not found, a LinkResolutionException will be thrown.

    The standard implementation of Link is StandardLink.

    • Method Detail

      • isResolved

        boolean isResolved()
        Checks if the link is resolved.

        A resolved link contains the target directly. A resolvable link only contains the identifier, acting as a pointer to the target.

        Returns:
        true if the link is resolved, false if unresolved

      • getStandardId

        StandardId getStandardId()
        Gets the identifier of the target.

        Returns the identifier, either directly or from the target.

        Specified by:
        getStandardId in interface StandardIdentifiable
        Returns:
        the standard identifier of the target

      • getTargetType

        Class<T> getTargetType()
        Gets the target type.

        Returns the target type, either directly or from the target.

        Returns:
        the target type of the link

      • getTargetTypeToken

        default TypeToken<T> getTargetTypeToken()
        Gets the target type token.

        Returns the target type as a TypeToken, either directly or from the target. A TypeToken is used to express generic parameterized types, such as Trade<Swap>: 

          new TypeToken<Trade<Swap>>() {};
        Returns:
        the target type of the link

      • resolve

        T resolve(LinkResolver resolver)
        Resolves this link using the specified resolver.

        In the resolvable state, the resolver is used to find the target, throwing an exception of the target cannot be found. In the resolved state, the directly embedded target is returned, without using the resolver.

        The returned target may contain other unresolved links. See Resolvable for a mechanism to resolve all links in an object graph.

        Parameters:
        resolver - the resolver to use for the resolution
        Returns:
        the target
        Throws:
        LinkResolutionException - if the target cannot be resolved
